q: .95 Now R258.26 Berlin- Ivory Coast's Alassane Ouattara said on Friday that he would reject a power sharing deal with the country's leader Laurent Gbagbo, in a German radio interview. I won the election with 54.1%... Therefore the question of a power share does not even arise. Mr Gbagbo was defeated at the ballot box- he must accept this and leave office, Alassane Ouattara told Deutschlandfunk radio. Gbagbo is refusing to hand over power to Alassane Ouattara - the man the world recognises as the rightful winner of November presidential polls. First there's the issue of David Cameron and George Osborne 's judgement, then there's the News of the World and what appears to be industrial phone hacking going on systematically.`` There's also the issue of the News Corp takeover of BSkyB and the apparent attempts by Jeremy Hunt , the Culture Secretary, to let that go through without proper scrutiny, and finally there's the extraordinary conduct of the police. Mr Andy Coulson resigned as editor of the News of the World in 2007 after the paper's former royal editor, Clive Goodman , and private investigator Glenn Mulcaire were jailed for phone hacking. Mr Eric Schmidt said that the company's three top executives had decided to`` clarify'' their roles so there's clear responsibility and accountability at the top of the company. The company had always argued in the past that its unusual leadership arrangements worked well, and that it reflected the fact that Google was operated differently from most traditional companies.
